section1.title: The product
section1.description: Our platform is a dedicated code editor built for university students starting their journey into STEM. We know that many students struggle — and sometimes drop out — when faced with intimidating coding environments. That's why we designed an editor that is simple, supportive, and motivating from day one.

section2.description: Students open a challenge, write their solution directly in the browser, and run it with one click. The editor gives instant feedback on errors and outputs, turning trial and error into a smooth learning experience. No setup, no distractions — just code, learn, and improve.

section3.description: Every submission updates automatically — progress bars fill up, points are awarded, and rankings refresh in real time. Students can see their growth at a glance, celebrate milestones, and compare results with classmates. Learning becomes engaging, competitive, and fun.

q1.question: 1. What is this platform?
q1.answer: It's an online code editor built for university students. You can practice, solve challenges, and track your progress — all in one place.

q2.question: 2. Do I need to download or install something?
q2.answer: No. Everything works directly in your web browser. Just log in and start coding.

q3.question: 3. How much does it cost?
q3.answer: It's completely free. This is a university project designed to help students learn programming.

q4.question: 4. Which programming languages are supported?
q4.answer: Currently C++ and Python are available, with plans to expand to more languages in the future.

q5.question: 5. How does progress tracking work?
q5.answer: Each time you submit code, the system saves your results, awards points, and updates your personal progress and rankings automatically.

q6.question: 6. Who can see my work?
q6.answer: You: always. Your professors: for assignments and feedback. Classmates: only rankings/points (not your actual code).

q7.question: 7. Is my data secure?
q7.answer: Yes. We only collect basic information (name, email, submissions). Your data is kept private and is not shared outside the university project.

q8.question: 8. Can teachers create activities?
q8.answer: Yes. We only collect basic information (name, email, submissions). Your data is kept private and is not shared outside the university project.

q9.question: 9. What happens if I find an error or bug?
q9.answer: Since this is a student project, there may be issues. Please let your professor or the dev team know so we can fix them quickly.

q10.question: 10. What makes this different from other code editors?
q10.answer: It's designed for learning, not for professionals. That means: Simple, distraction-free interface. Built-in university assignments. Instant feedback and rankings to keep you motivated.

about.description: We’re building a code editor designed for university students, combining simplicity, performance, and learning-oriented features. Unlike generic editors, our platform integrates directly with coursework, weekly challenges, and real-time feedback — helping students not just code, but grow their skills in an engaging way.

mission.title: Our mission
mission.description: To help students overcome the fear of coding by providing a supportive, practical, and engaging learning environment. We aim to reduce dropout rates in STEM by turning coding into a skill that feels achievable and even fun.

vision.title: Our vision
vision.description: To be the first stepping stone into coding for thousands of students — transforming fear into curiosity, confusion into confidence, and beginners into future innovators.

1.title: 1. About This Project
1.content: This platform was created by students for students, as part of a university initiative. Our main goal is to help students learn coding in a safe and supportive environment.

2.title: 2. What Data We Collect
2.content: We do not collect unnecessary personal data.
list: Basic account info: name, email, and role (student/teacher).
Usage data: code submissions, progress, and scores.
Optional info: profile picture or avatar if you choose to add one.

3.title: 3. How We Use Your Data
3.content: We do not sell, rent, or share your data with outside companies.
list: To allow you to log in and use the code editor.
To track your learning progress, points, and rankings.
To help teachers review student activity and give feedback.
To improve the platform based on how students use it.

4.title: 4. Data Storage & Security
4.content: All data is stored securely using university-approved tools. We do our best to protect your information, but remember this is a student project and not a commercial product.

5.title: 5. Your Rights
list: You can request to delete your account or data anytime.
You can ask us what information we have stored about you.
You may stop using the platform at any time.

6.title: 6. Contact
6.content: If you have questions, issues, or concerns, please contact the student team behind the project or your course professor.
